column4: Could someone tell me if Ubuntu comes with the necessary drivers to run "GeForce GTX 295 1792MB" video card on a 64 bit system?
what version of ubuntu?
if you have intrepid you should be good
see http://www.nvidia.com/object/linux_display_amd64_180.44.html that driver is in intrepid
I got that from http://www.nvidia.com/Download/index.aspx?lang=en-us, you are in doubt you should contact nvidia support
yea, the GFX 295 is not listed there :-/
it is listed under http://www.nvidia.com/object/linux_display_ia32_180.22.html but thats not a 64 bit driver is it?
sorry, I didn't make myself clear. If you go to http://www.nvidia.com/Download/index.aspx?lang=en-us and select your card it will say that driver supports it
support for your card was added in -180.22, its currently at -180.44. If it doesn't work in intrepid it will work in jaunty
Ahh i see, i didnt see it on the list, but that was under "added support for the following GPUs" my mistake
but short story, if it doesn't work in intrepid it will work in jaunty
jaunty being the upcoming release in 20 or so days?
yep
in fact if you gimme a sec I can verify that for you
thank you very much, greatly appreciated
thank you
yep, the driver is in jaunty, unfortunately not in intrepid
however I would imagine it would get backported after jaunty is released
the beta is still availble to use before the release, if i want to try before that right?
of course, you can download jaunty now if you so wish
so all in all i should be fine purchasing this graphics card and trying ubuntu? :)
correct
I know how worrying it is building your machine :)
yea, and i have been using mac for about 4 years, so much new stuff to look at!
